description.narrative: By 2020, Government has improved capacity to provide increased access to inclusive and quality early learning services, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid), Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 4. By 2020, girls and boys benefit equitably from improved preschool education and enhanced quality of basic education including in emergencies.

participating-org.narrative: AXBOROT VA PEDAGOGIKA TEXNOLOGIYALA INNOVATSION MARKAZI UNDER THE MINIS OF PRESCHOOL EDUCATION

mailing-address.narrative: 2nd floor Poytakht Business Centre 16 Sharof Rashidov Street Tashkent 100029

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) early-learning / pre-primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of early learning / pre-primary education teacher training
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary policy, leadership, and budget

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, Government has improved capacity to provide increased access to inclusive and quality early learning services

description.narrative: Supporting capacity development of the government officials and experts on implementing quality ECE programmes is enhancing the quality of preschool education; and designing and modeling alternative models of preschool programmes is aimed at enabling government scale up for expansion of access to preschool education. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of teachers trained to provide distance support to learners with UNICEF support in the reporting year [COVID]
Number of schools implementing safe school protocols (COVID-19 prevention and control) [COVIDSitRep]
Number of children reached with pre-primary, primary and secondary online/distance education lesson with UNICEF support in the reporting year [COVID]
Number of children supported with distance/home-based learning [COVIDSitRep]
Availability of Master trainers with capacity to train pedagogical staff in pre-school educational institutions to implement standards and curricula

actual.value: 2019:A core team of 32 Master Trainers at national level and 185 trainers from 14 regions trained.

title.narrative: Availability of pre- and in-service training programme for preschool providers on competency-based teaching and assessment

actual.value: 2019:Comprehensive training modules available and used for in-service training

title.narrative: Availability of Early Learning and Development Standards (ELDS) in line with Competency based curriculum for preschool education

actual.value: 2019:ELDS in line with competency based curricumum for preschool education available and implemented in preschools

title.narrative: Number of regions implementing communications strategy to address behavior related ECE
Availability of joint (GOU/UNICEF) communications strategy to promote utilization of ECE services at national and subnational levels
Availability of alternative models of preschool education, in order to ensure equal access of children to preschool educational services

actual.value: 2019:One of the alternative models (one year preprimary) is implemented by government; two other alternatives to be modelled in 2020
